column4: remot: dont understand, it was working first time around using File Browser last week with the live cd...
it's how hard your pc is working on average over the past X minutes.
to be more precise, the CPU load for your box.
what does a load average of 1 mean?
100% cpu usage for the past X minutes
the 3 you see in top are usually something around 2, 5 and 10 minutes or so
ive seen load averages of more than 1 sometimes. Sometimes like 4! how can my computer work at 400%
It's calculated per core, so if you have more cores it can go well over 100%.
instead of saying you have a question, how about just ask it? We can't read your mind

I try to answer questions of people who use software I don't use or even heard of, by the use of  a great invention called google ;-) And even so, just ask away and if someone happens to know the answer they'll be sure to answer you.
so run screen inside screen, with the splits inside the second screen?
it's a mind fck! LOL ^aa^aa O_o!! HEH

mind your language though, it's still a public channel. However, the nested screens seem to be able to do what you want, don't they? Since you'll either need to run the commands to create the split anyway, a second screen would be sufficient.
sorry, too excited. havent been on irc in 3+ years heh
would you mind if we kept this channel to a help channel? I'm sure they love you in #ubuntu-offtopic.
